protocol_name: Root Growth and Spatial Distribution Characteristics for Seedlings raised in Substrate and Transplanted Cotton
protocol_name_html: Root Growth and Spatial Distribution Characteristics for Seedlings raised in Substrate and Transplanted Cotton
protocol_affiliation: Institute of Cotton Research of Chinese Academy of Agricultural Sciences
manuscript_citation: Zhi X, Han Y, Li Y, Wang G, Feng L, Yang B, Fan Z, Lei Y, Du W, Mao S (2017) Root growth and spatial distribution characteristics for seedlings raised in substrate and transplanted cotton. PLoS ONE 12(12): e0190032. doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0190032

components.data: Substrate seedling transplanted cotton
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Substrate seedling transplanted cotton

components.data: Seedlings were transplanted into 10-cm-deep holes in field that were dug with a hand machine which was homemade
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Seedlings were transplanted into 10-cm-deep holes in field that were dug with a hand machine which was homemade

components.data: Soil-cube seedling transplanting system
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Soil-cube seedling transplanting system

components.data: Columned soil blocks (4-6 cm in diameter and 8-12 cm high), made of soil and fertilizer (N:15%, P2O5:15%, K2O:15%) with corresponding sizes of molds, were prepared before planting
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Columned soil blocks (4-6 cm in diameter and 8-12 cm high), made of soil and fertilizer (N:15%, P2O5:15%, K2O:15%) with corresponding sizes of molds, were prepared before planting

components.data: The seeded soil cubes were placed neatly in seedling beds (10 cm deep and 2 m wide) in a greenhouse-like hut
components.name: Section

source_data.section: The seeded soil cubes were placed neatly in seedling beds (10 cm deep and 2 m wide) in a greenhouse-like hut

components.data: One seed was sown in each block as soon as watering occurred
components.name: Section

source_data.section: One seed was sown in each block as soon as watering occurred

components.data: Blocks with seedlings were transplanted into 10-cm-deep holes manually in the experimental plots
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Blocks with seedlings were transplanted into 10-cm-deep holes manually in the experimental plots

components.data: Direct sowing systems with plastic mulching
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Direct sowing systems with plastic mulching

components.data: Cotton seeds were covered with moist soil in all systems and mulched with wide plastic film (6 µm thick and 120 cm wide) that was held in place by burying its edges with soil along two rows
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Cotton seeds were covered with moist soil in all systems and mulched with wide plastic film (6 µm thick and 120 cm wide) that was held in place by burying its edges with soil along two rows

components.data: After emergence, holes were cut in the film to allow the seedlings to emerge
components.name: Section

source_data.section: After emergence, holes were cut in the film to allow the seedlings to emerge

components.data: Root samples were collected once before each irrigation event (9 times) during each season
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Root samples were collected once before each irrigation event (9 times) during each season

components.data: A soil core device (7 cm in diameter, 10 cm high) was used to obtain samples to minimize horizontal and vertical root damage.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: A soil core device (7 cm in diameter, 10 cm high) was used to obtain samples to minimize horizontal and vertical root damage.

components.data: Placed in greenhouse-like huts
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Placed in greenhouse-like huts

components.data: To study the horizontal distributions of the roots, root cores (soil samples containing roots) were collected in two directions (east and west) from the trunk region (0 cm) of the plants at distances of 20 and 40 cm
components.name: Section

source_data.section: To study the horizontal distributions of the roots, root cores (soil samples containing roots) were collected in two directions (east and west) from the trunk region (0 cm) of the plants at distances of 20 and 40 cm

components.data: To study the vertical root distribution, the auger was inserted to a depth of 120 cm from the soil surface.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: To study the vertical root distribution, the auger was inserted to a depth of 120 cm from the soil surface.

components.data: The resulting soil core was divided into 12 blocks of 0-10 cm, 10-20 cm, 20-30 cm, 30-40 cm, 40-50 cm, 50-60 cm, 60-70 cm, 70-80 cm, 80-90 cm, 90-100 cm, 100-110 cm and 110-120 cm in both sampling directions, and the soil was removed carefully using hand implements from each block to a depth of 10 cm.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: The resulting soil core was divided into 12 blocks of 0-10 cm, 10-20 cm, 20-30 cm, 30-40 cm, 40-50 cm, 50-60 cm, 60-70 cm, 70-80 cm, 80-90 cm, 90-100 cm, 100-110 cm and 110-120 cm in both sampling directions, and the soil was removed carefully using hand implements from each block to a depth of 10 cm.

components.data: Each 10-cm-deep root core was placed in a 0.05 cm diameter circular grid mesh sieve and washed under running water to remove soil particles from the roots.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Each 10-cm-deep root core was placed in a 0.05 cm diameter circular grid mesh sieve and washed under running water to remove soil particles from the roots.

components.data: Collected root samples were scanned with a scanner (Phantom 9800X, MiCROTEK, Shanghai, China) and analyzed using the DT-SCAN software (Delta-T Devices Ltd, UK) to determine the root length (RL), average root diameter and root surface area (RA).
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Collected root samples were scanned with a scanner (Phantom 9800X, MiCROTEK, Shanghai, China) and analyzed using the DT-SCAN software (Delta-T Devices Ltd, UK) to determine the root length (RL), average root diameter and root surface area (RA).

components.data: The root length density (RLD, root length per volume of soil, mm/cm3) and root surface area density (RAD, root surface area per volume of soil, mm2/cm3) were determined as spatial distribution characteristics.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: The root length density (RLD, root length per volume of soil, mm/cm3) and root surface area density (RAD, root surface area per volume of soil, mm2/cm3) were determined as spatial distribution characteristics.

components.data: In both experiments in each year, the land was ploughed and irrigated in early spring before sowing. In all plots, 225 kg ha-1 N, 150 kg ha-1 P2O5 and 225 kg ha-1 K2O was applied. All of the fertilizers were broadcasted evenly across the soil and incorporated into the top 20 cm of the soil before sowing. Approximately 45 mm of supplemental water (per irrigation event) was added by flooding the furrows and according to the recommendations of local agronomists. Other field management strategies were used based on local agronomic practices. Weeds were manually controlled before plastic mulch being used and pesticides were used to control insects and diseases.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: In both experiments in each year, the land was ploughed and irrigated in early spring before sowing. In all plots, 225 kg ha-1 N, 150 kg ha-1 P2O5 and 225 kg ha-1 K2O was applied. All of the fertilizers were broadcasted evenly across the soil and incorporated into the top 20 cm of the soil before sowing. Approximately 45 mm of supplemental water (per irrigation event) was added by flooding the furrows and according to the recommendations of local agronomists. Other field management strategies were used based on local agronomic practices. Weeds were manually controlled before plastic mulch being used and pesticides were used to control insects and diseases.

components.data: Two cotton seeds were sown in each cavity of trays containing 100 cavities (60 cm*33 cm*5 cm)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Two cotton seeds were sown in each cavity of trays containing 100 cavities (60 cm*33 cm*5 cm)
